meaning: 가장 짧고 쿨한 반응 (예상했던 일이라는 뜻)

B: Figures.
A: He showed up late again.
B: Called it.
A: Guess what? The train got delayed again.
B: Sounds about right.
A: She totally bailed on the plan.
B: Knew it.

meaning: 일반적인 공연, 연설, 쇼 등을 보는 사람들
examples: A: How was the concert last night?
B: The crowd was insane! Everyone was jumping and screaming.
A: Did you see the game?
B: Yeah, the spectators were on fire!
A: Her speech was so powerful.
B: The audience was totally mesmerized.
A: That YouTube live got so many viewers!
B: Yeah, people couldn’t stop watching.
A: The fans went crazy when she walked on stage.
B: Of course, she’s a legend!

similar: My ears are about to fall off!
I’m literally turning into an icicle.
examples: A: Bro, why aren’t you wearing a hat?
B: I forgot, and now my ears are about to fall off!
A: Ugh, I hate winter. It’s freezing out!
B: Yeah, it’s brick outside. Let’s get inside.
A: Man, it’s cold as hell today!
B: No joke, I’m literally turning into an icicle.

A: Did you watch that new sci-fi movie?
B: Yeah, the storyline was really intriguing. I couldn’t stop thinking about it!
A: I just finished that book you recommended.
B: Right? It’s fascinating, isn’t it?
A: The way he explains the universe is so cool.
B: I know! His lectures are totally mind-blowing.
A: I started a new drama, and I’m already hooked.
B: Same! The storyline is so captivating.
A: That speech really made me think about life.
B: Yeah, it was so thought-provoking.
A: The book you gave me changed the way I see the world.
B: I know, it’s really eye-opening.
A: That debate was actually really deep.
B: Yeah, some of the points were really profound.
A: I just watched this crazy documentary on society.
B: Was it mind-blowing or just thought-provoking?

meaning: 우린 정말 오래전부터 알고 지낸 사이야
similar: We’ve been through a lot together.
We’ve been tight since day one.
examples: A: How do you know Chris?
B: Oh, we go way back. We met in high school.
A: You and Emily seem really close.
B: Yeah, we’ve known each other forever.
A: You and Jake still hang out?
B: Of course! We’ve been tight since day one.
A: How long have you been friends with Mark?
B: Man, we go way back. We’ve been through a lot together.

similar: That hits me right in the feels.
examples: A: Wow, they’re playing our favorite childhood song!
B: Man, this takes me back!
A: Look at this picture of us from 10 years ago.
B: Whoa, that brings back memories.
A: I found our old high school yearbook.
B: Major throwback! Let me see!
A: Remember when we used to play this video game all night?
B: Yeah, that hits me right in the feels.

similar: I need you to fill this in.
Knock this form out for me.
examples: A: Before we start, can you fill this out?
B: Sure, no problem.
A: Hey, I need you to fill this in before the appointment.
B: Alright, I’ll do it now.
A: Can you sign this real quick?
B: Yeah, just give me a sec.
A: We just need you to complete this form.
B: Got it, I’ll hand it back in a minute.

similar: I have no memory of that.
examples: A: Do you remember Sarah from college?
B: Hmm… doesn’t ring a bell.
A: You’ve seen this movie before, right?
B: I have no memory of that.
A: You met my friend Jake last year!
B: Sorry, not ringing any bells.
A: What was the name of that restaurant we went to?
B: Ugh, I’m totally drawing a blank.

primary: He called off the project. That's music to my ears. I was already spread too thin
examples: A: The boss decided to scrap the project.
B: Oh, that’s music to my ears! I was already juggling too much.
A: They pulled the plug on the expansion plan.
B: Thank God! I had way too much on my plate already.

similar: I wouldn’t say no to a coffee.
I could really go for a coffee right now.
I need some caffeine in my system.
I could really go for a coffee.
examples: A: You look tired.
B: Yeah, I could use some coffee right now.
A: Want me to grab you a coffee?
B: Oh, I wouldn’t say no to that!
A: Dude, you okay?
B: No, I’m dying for a coffee.
A: Wanna stop by a café?
B: Yes! I could really go for a coffee right now.
A: You got another A on your test?
B: Yep!
A: Man, you’re on a roll!
A: You’ve won five games in a row.
B: I know, I’m on fire!
A: Another deal closed?
B: Yep, I’m killing it this month.
A: You’re crushing it at the gym, dude!
B: Can’t stop, won’t stop!
A: How’s the merger going?
B: Ugh, the deal fell through.
A: I thought you were closing the deal today.
B: Yeah, but they backed out last minute.
A: Did you guys sign the contract?
B: No, it didn’t pan out.
A: What happened with that investment?
B: Man, the whole thing went south.

similar: Singing in the shower like a rockstar
examples: A: What’s your guilty pleasure?
B: Honestly? Watching cringey TikToks for hours.
A: Do you have any guilty pleasures?
B: Yeah… I still listen to early 2000s boy bands.
A: What’s something you love but don’t want to admit?
B: Ugh, I secretly love super cheesy rom-coms.
A: Are you really getting a double cheeseburger?
B: Yep! It’s my cheat day.
A: Bro, you just ate two donuts.
B: Calories don’t count today!
A: You’re getting dessert too?!
B: Treat yourself, man!
A: You usually eat super clean.
B: Yeah, but diet starts tomorrow.

primary: For lack of a better word
examples: A: What was the vibe at the party?
B: Uh… for lack of a better word, chaotic.
A: How would you describe your boss?
B: For lack of a better term, a total perfectionist.
A: What was the movie like?
B: It was, for lack of a better way to put it, a complete disaster.
A: Is he a good leader?
B: I mean, for lack of a better word, he’s… intense.
A: The company changed the policy again.
B: Ugh, it is what it is.
A: I got stuck in traffic for two hours.
B: Damn… that sucks, but it is what it is.
A: The restaurant ran out of our favorite dish.
B: Ah, well. That’s life.
A: My laptop just crashed before I could save my work.
B: What can you do?
A: How was the interview?
B: Right off the bat, they asked me a tough question.
A: Did you like him?
B: Yeah, right off the bat, we just clicked.
A: When did you know you wanted the job?
B: Honestly? From the get-go.
A: She rejected your offer?
B: Yeah, straight up. No hesitation.
A: How long have you guys been close?
B: Oh, from day one. We just clicked.
A: Did you like your new job?
B: Nah, I knew from the get-go it wasn’t for me.
A: They’ve been arguing a lot lately.
B: Honestly, they’ve had issues since day one.
A: When did you know she was the one?
B: From the very beginning!
A: Should I bring a jacket?
B: Yeah, better safe than sorry.
A: Do you really think we need travel insurance?
B: Of course! Can’t be too careful.
A: Should I print an extra copy of the report?
B: Yeah, just to be on the safe side.
A: I think I’ll double-check my answers.
B: Good idea. No harm in being cautious.
A: I don’t know if I should apply for this job…
B: Just go for it! Better to take action than do nothing.
A: I feel like my progress is too slow.
B: Slow progress is still progress. Keep it moving!
A: I don’t know if this idea will work…
B: You miss 100% of the shots you don’t take!
A: I’m afraid of making the wrong choice.
B: Hey, better to keep moving than stay stuck.

primary: You can never be too careful
examples: A: Do I really need a jacket?
B: You can never be too careful. It might get cold later.
A: Should we bring extra water?
B: Yeah, just to be on the safe side.
A: Do you think I should back up my files?
B: Of course! Better safe than sorry.
A: Do we really need travel insurance?
B: I mean, you never know. It’s better to be safe.
A: Wanna go check out that new jazz bar?
B: Oh, that’s right up my alley!
A: This new fantasy novel just came out.
B: Ooh, that’s totally my thing!
A: They’re looking for someone who loves social media marketing.
B: That’s right in my wheelhouse!
A: This restaurant has a super cozy aesthetic.
B: 100% my vibe. Let’s go!
A: They’re giving out free coffee samples!
B: Oh, this is for me!
A: I found this cute little bookstore café.
B: OMG, that’s totally my thing!
A: This festival is all about indie music and chill vibes.
B: Ooh, this has my name written all over it!
A: Let’s book a beach vacation next month.
B: Yes! This is exactly what I need.
A: We need someone who’s good with people for this role.
B: Oh, then Alex is perfect. He’s a total people person.
A: How does she make friends so easily?
B: She’s just a social butterfly.
A: I’m not the best at networking events…
B: It’s okay! You don’t have to be a natural with people. Just be yourself!
A: He’s always surrounded by people.
B: Yeah, he’s super charismatic.
A: "Bless you!"
B: "Thanks!"
A: "Bless you… again!"
B: "I know, my allergies are killing me."
A: "You good?"
B: "Yeah, just a little dust."
A: "Gesundheit!"
B: "Oh, thanks!"

primary: I have a hunch, gut feeling
examples: A: Do you think she likes him?
B: I have a hunch. She keeps looking at him.
A: Are you sure we should go this way?
B: I have a gut feeling this is the right path.
A: Do you think it’ll rain today?
B: Something tells me it will.
A: Are you sure this deal will go through?
B: I don’t know why, but I just know it.
A: Should we trust him?
B: My instincts are telling me no.

primary:
Just go with your gut
What does your gut say?
examples: A: I don’t know which job offer to take…
B: Just go with your gut!
A: I feel like something’s off about him…
B: Trust your gut. If you feel weird, there’s probably a reason.
A: Should I take the risk or play it safe?
B: What does your gut say?
A: I can’t decide between these two options.
B: Go with your first instinct. Don’t overthink it.

primary: Spot on, on the spot, put someone on the spot
examples: A: What did you think of my presentation?
B: Spot on! You explained everything perfectly.
A: How did he react when you told him?
B: He was shocked. I told him on the spot.
A: The professor asked me a question I wasn’t prepared for.
B: Ugh, he totally put you on the spot!
A: How do you know Chris?
B: Oh, we go way back. We met in high school.
A: You and Emily seem really close.
B: Yeah, we’ve known each other forever.
A: You and Jake still hang out?
B: Of course! We’ve been tight since day one.
A: How long have you been friends with Mark?
B: Man, we go way back. We’ve been through a lot together.
A: Who’s that guy you were talking to?
B: Oh, that’s my homie from high school.
A: We’ve been friends for 10 years now.
B: For real? That’s a real homie right there!
A: I don’t know if I can trust him.
B: Nah, he’s good. He’s been my homie since day one.
A: Yo homie, what’s the move tonight?
B: Let’s hit up that new bar downtown!

primary:
Run some errands
Hit the road
Get it together
Keep it together
Put it together
Have a blast
Cut it out

examples: A: It’s already 11 PM!
B: Yeah, you’d better be off before it gets too late.
A: I have an early meeting tomorrow.
B: Then you should get going.
A: The party was fun, but I think it’s time to head out.
B: Yeah, let’s make a move.
A: The train leaves in 10 minutes!
B: We’d better get a move on!
A: You look so tired.
B: Yeah, I had trouble sleeping last night.
A: Did you sleep well?
B: Not really, I was tossing and turning all night.
A: Why do you look so out of it?
B: I barely got any sleep.
A: Why are you drinking so much coffee?
B: I was up all night working on my project.
A: Alright, I gotta go.
B: Cool, have a good one!
A: Thanks for your help today.
B: No problem! Have a great one!
A: I’ll see you tomorrow.
B: Alright, take it easy!
A: Heading home now?
B: Yeah, catch you later!
A: How was the trip?
B: It was amazing! I had a blast!
A: Did you enjoy the party?
B: Yeah, I had so much fun!
A: That concert was insane!
B: I know, I had the time of my life!
A: Thanks for coming today!
B: No problem! I had a great time!
A: Do you know where Jake went?
B: Beats me! I haven’t seen him all day.
A: What’s the answer to this question?
B: No clue.
A: Why is the subway so delayed?
B: I have no idea.
A: When did they change the meeting time?
B: Search me! I wasn’t even told.
A: When’s the deadline?
B: Dunno. You should ask the manager.
A: Are they dating?
B: Dunno, but they sure act like it.
A: Where’s Alex?
B: Beats me. Haven’t seen him all day.
A: Do we have a test tomorrow?
B: Not sure.
A: How long will this meeting take?
B: Who knows?
A: How did you feel when you almost missed your flight?
B: Man, my heart skipped a beat! I thought I was gonna miss it.
A: He finally asked you out?! How did you feel?
B: My heart skipped a beat! I couldn’t believe it.
A: I heard a weird noise outside my window last night.
B: Ugh, my heart would’ve skipped a beat too.
A: I saw my childhood crush today!
B: No way! Your heart totally skipped a beat, huh?
A: Hi, we’re a party of four. Is there a wait?
B: Yes, about 20 minutes.
A: How long is the wait right now?
B: About 30 minutes, but you can wait at the bar.
A: Do we need to wait, or is there an open table?
B: You’re in luck! We have one available now.
A: Is there a line for takeout orders?
B: Nope, you can order right away!
A: Let’s split the bill.
B: Nah, it’s on me!
A: How much do I owe you?
B: Nothing! This one's on me.
A: You don’t have to pay for my coffee.
B: No worries, my treat!
A: Shoot, I forgot my wallet.
B: Don’t worry, I got you!

primary: Bang for the buck, solid deal
examples: A: This hotel room is huge, and it’s only $80 a night!
B: Wow, that’s serious bang for the buck!
A: I got this smartwatch for half the price during the sale.
B: That’s a solid deal!
A: The lunch special here is only $10, and you get a full meal!
B: Sounds like a good bang for the buck!
A: I found a laptop for $300, brand new.
B: That’s a solid deal! You should get it.
A: Wow, it’s really warm today.
B: Yeah, it’s warm for November!
A: I thought it’d be colder by now.
B: Same! This is warmer than usual for November.
A: It’s still so nice outside.
B: Not bad for November, huh?
A: I wasn’t expecting this kind of weather in November.
B: Right? It’s unusually warm for this time of year.
A: How’s that budget hotel?
B: It’s good for the price!
A: Is that $10 pizza any good?
B: Not bad for the price!
A: This speaker isn’t high-end, but it’s decent.
B: Yeah, pretty decent for the price.
A: $5 for a coffee?
B: It’s expensive, but at least it’s worth the money.
A: Can you say that out loud?
B: Sure! "The answer is B!"
A: You’re laughing. What’s funny?
B: Oh, I was just reading something funny out loud.
A: Did you just say something?
B: Oops, I was thinking out loud.
A: I can’t hear you.
B: Okay, I’ll speak up!
A: Do you really think we should move to another city?
B: Oh no, I’m just thinking out loud.
A: Did you mean that seriously?
B: Nah, just throwing ideas out there.
A: Are you saying we should fire him?
B: Whoa, not saying that! Just thinking out loud.
A: Should we really spend that much money?
B: Don’t mind me, just thinking out loud.
A: Would you ever move to another country?
B: Hmm, I’ve never really entertained that idea before.
A: Should we try launching this new product?
B: It’s worth entertaining the idea. Let’s discuss it.
A: Are you seriously thinking about quitting your job?
B: I’m just entertaining the idea for now.
A: Would you ever consider a long-distance relationship?
B: I don’t know… but I’ll give it some thought.
A: Is that budget phone any good?
B: Yeah, it’s a great bang for your buck!
A: $20 for all-you-can-eat sushi?
B: That’s the best bang for your buck!
A: Should I get these wireless earbuds?
B: Definitely. For this price, they’re totally worth every penny.
A: I got this jacket for 70% off.
B: No way! That’s a steal!
A: How’s the iced coffee?
B: Mmm, it hits the spot!
A: Was that ramen good?
B: Oh yeah, it really hit the spot!
A: This milkshake is so refreshing.
B: Right? Just what I was craving!
A: That was a long day… I need a cold beer.
B: Same! That would be exactly what I need.
A: Bro, this movie build-up is crazy!
B: I know, I can’t take this suspense!
A: The way this song builds up is insane.
B: Right? The drop is gonna be legendary!
A: This game is so close, the build-up is crazy!
B: Yeah, I’m on the edge of my seat!
A: I can feel the tension in this episode.
B: Same! The suspense is killing me!
A: You’ve been quiet for a while. A penny for your thoughts?
B: Oh, I was just thinking about my weekend plans.
A: You seem lost in thought.
B: Yeah, I’m trying to figure something out.
A: Why so quiet?
B: Just tired, nothing much.
A: Something on your mind? You look stressed.
B: Yeah, just work stuff.
A: Ugh, my boss gave me extra work again!
B: I know it’s annoying, but don’t get worked up over it.
A: He totally freaked out when he saw the mistake.
B: Yeah, he gets worked up too easily.
A: She gets all riled up over the smallest things.
B: I know, she needs to chill.
A: I was just a few minutes late, and my mom totally lost it!
B: Whoa, sounds like she got worked up for no reason.

primary: Oh great, it is what it is
examples: A: The game got postponed due to the rain.
B: Oh great, it is what it is.
A: I failed my driving test again.
B: That sucks, but it is what it is. Just try again.
A: My boss just assigned me extra work at the last minute.
B: Ugh, nothing we can do about it.
A: The restaurant is full, so we have to wait an hour.
B: Oh well, that’s life.
A: Hurry up! We need to leave now!
B: What’s the hurry? The train doesn’t leave for another 20 minutes.
A: Come on, let’s go!
B: Chill out, what’s the rush?
A: I need to finish this ASAP!
B: Relax, we still have plenty of time.
A: Walk faster!
B: Why are you in such a rush?
A: We should have left 10 minutes ago. What’s the holdup?
B: Sorry! I couldn’t find my keys.
A: We’ve been in line forever.
B: Yeah, what’s taking so long?
A: Why aren’t we moving?
B: I don’t know, but what’s the holdup?
A: The food should be here by now.
B: Let me call and ask what’s the delay.
A: I’m so stressed about this test.
B: Hang loose, man. You got this!
A: We’re running late!
B: Chill out, we’ll make it on time.
A: Should I plan everything in detail?
B: Nah, just go with the flow.
A: I don’t know what to do in this situation.
B: Keep it cool, you’ll figure it out.
A: Do you have any vegan options?
B: Of course! Salads, smoothies, plant-based burgers—you name it!
A: I need some help moving this weekend.
B: Just say the word! I’ll be there.
A: I don’t know what I want to eat.
B: We have everything—burgers, pasta, sushi—you name it!
A: Can I get some advice on my project?
B: Whatever you need, you name it!
A: I didn’t think I could finish the project on time.
B: But you pulled it off! Great job!
A: Do you think I can wear this bright yellow jacket?
B: Of course! You can totally pull it off!
A: I was so nervous before my performance.
B: No worries, you nailed it!
A: That was a tough challenge.
B: Yeah, but you made it work!

primary: Thank you, you made my day
examples: A: I got you your favorite coffee.
B: Thank you! You totally made my day!
A: You did an amazing job on your project.
B: Wow, that compliment just made my day!
A: I found your lost wallet!
B: No way! You made my week!
A: I really appreciate your help.
B: No problem! Happy to brighten your day!
A: Ugh, traffic is bad today.
B: Yeah, but could be worse. At least we’re moving.
A: I only got a B on my test.
B: Hey, could be worse! At least you passed!
A: I lost my phone, but I found it an hour later.
B: Well, could’ve been worse! At least you got it back.
A: My flight got delayed.
B: That sucks, but at least it’s not canceled. Could be worse!
A: I have something important to tell you.
B: Alright, hit me with it!
A: I know a crazy rumor about Jake.
B: Spill the beans!
A: The boss just sent an email about the project.
B: Lay it on me.
A: I need to tell you something, but it’s not good.
B: Give it to me straight.
A: I just got some wild news.
B: I’m all ears!

primary: Every cloud has a silver lining.
examples: A: I can’t believe I failed the test.
B: Don’t worry, every cloud has a silver lining. Maybe this will motivate you to do even better next time.
A: I lost my job today…
B: That’s tough, but remember—when one door closes, another one opens.
A: This breakup is the worst thing ever.
B: I know it feels that way now, but things will get better.
A: Everything is going wrong today.
B: Hey, look on the bright side. At least tomorrow is a new day!
A: I totally failed my test today.
B: That sucks, but the silver lining is you can retake it next week.
A: Our flight got delayed by three hours!
B: Ugh, but the silver lining is we have more time to grab food.
A: I lost my phone at the party.
B: That’s rough, but the silver lining is at least you had fun!
A: I didn’t get the job I wanted.
B: That’s disappointing, but looking on the bright side, maybe a better opportunity is waiting for you.
A: You just won three rounds in a row!
B: I know, I’m on a roll!
A: Wow, you’ve been closing so many deals lately.
B: Yeah, I’m on fire!
A: You’re doing great on your diet.
B: Thanks! I’m really in the zone.
A: Another A on your test?
B: Yup! I’m killing it this semester.

primary: I was spread too thin, I was in way over my head
examples: A: You look exhausted. What happened?
B: I was spread too thin. I took on way too many tasks this week.
A: How was the new project?
B: Honestly? I was in way over my head. It was way too complicated for me.
A: Why didn’t you finish the report?
B: I had too much on my plate. I just couldn’t get to it.
A: How’s your new job?
B: Man, I bit off more than I could chew. It’s way harder than I expected.
A: Did you update the report with my suggestions?
B: Yep! I’ve already incorporated your suggestions.
A: I think we should change the layout a little.
B: I’ve already taken your feedback into account. Check it out!
A: Hey, don’t forget to fix those typos I mentioned.
B: No worries, I’ve already made those updates.
A: I sent you some changes for the website design.
B: Got it! Your suggestions have already been implemented.
A: Ugh, that guy keeps cutting people in line.
B: What a jerk!
A: He ghosted her after three dates.
B: Wow, what a douchebag.
A: He keeps bragging about his new car.
B: That guy is such a tool.
A: Should I ask Mark for help?
B: I wouldn’t. He will just mess with you.
A: My new manager seems really strict.
B: Yeah, he will give you a hard time.
A: I think Jake is being nice to me.
B: Be careful, he will play you if you're not careful.
A: Are you at home?
B: Yeah, I’m around.
A: Can you help me move some stuff later?
B: Sure! I’m around if you need me.
A: Where are you? I need to talk.
B: I’m in the area. Let’s meet up.
A: Will you be at the office today?
B: Yeah, I’ll be around all day.
A: I’m so nervous about this presentation.
B: Don’t stress, I got your back!
A: I don’t know if I can do this alone.
B: You’re not alone, I got you.
A: I think I messed up…
B: No worries, I got your back.
A: I need some help moving this weekend.
B: Of course, I got you!
A: Is that a good phone to buy?
B: IMO, it’s not worth the price.
A: Should we switch to a different brand?
B: TBH, I think we should.
A: What do you think of her new haircut?
B: FWIW, I love it!
A: Should we delay the project?
B: Just my two cents, but I think we should wait.

primary: Keep warm, stay healthy, stay cozy, bundle up
examples: A: It’s getting so cold these days.
B: Yeah, stay cozy and keep warm!
A: I’m heading out now.
B: It’s freezing outside! Bundle up!
A: I’ve been feeling a bit under the weather.
B: Oh no, stay healthy and take care!
A: I love staying in and watching movies on cold days.
B: Same! Perfect time to stay cozy with a blanket.
A: I was so thirsty. This iced tea is amazing!
B: Right? It hits the spot!
A: After that long run, this burger tastes even better.
B: Yeah, that really hit the spot!
A: It’s freezing outside. This hot cocoa is just what I needed.
B: Agreed! So satisfying!
A: I’ve been craving ramen all day.
B: Well, enjoy! I bet it’ll hit the spot!
A: Wow, this iced coffee is so good.
B: Yeah, it’s refreshingly cool!
A: The breeze feels amazing after that heat.
B: Right? It’s so crisp and cool.
A: I needed this cold soda after a long day.
B: Super refreshing, right?
A: The pool water is perfect today.
B: Nice and cool!
A: Do you have time to sit down for a coffee?
B: Not really, I’ll just grab one to drink on the go.
A: Why are you drinking so fast?
B: I need to leave soon, so I just chugged my coffee.
A: Let’s stop by that standing bar for a quick drink.
B: Sounds good! I love those spots.
A: He didn’t even show up to his best friend’s wedding.
B: Wow. That speaks volumes.
A: They had a meeting, but he wasn’t invited.
B: That says a lot about what they think of him.
A: She looked so happy when she got the job offer.
B: Yeah, her smile spoke volumes!
A: He donated all his money to charity.
B: That makes a strong statement about his character.
A: He doesn’t need to explain. His work speaks for itself.
B: Exactly! The quality of his work is enough to show his talent.
A: Why don’t you defend yourself?
B: My actions speak for themselves. I don’t need to say anything more.
A: Did you see the new car?
B: Wow, that car speaks for itself. It looks amazing!
A: Why do you think he’s so successful?
B: Well, the results speak for themselves.
A: I got this leather jacket for only $30!
B: No way! That was a steal!
A: Look at these brand-new shoes. Guess how much?
B: I don’t know… $150?
A: Nope! $50!
B: Whoa, that’s a crazy deal!
A: I found a MacBook on sale for half the price.
B: What a bargain! You got it for a steal!
A: This couch was originally $500, but I got it for $100!
B: That’s such a good deal!

primary: We should stock up it's a steal
examples: A: Look at this! Toilet paper is 80% off!
B: Whoa! We should stock up. It’s a steal!
A: These snacks are buy one, get one free.
B: Let’s buy in bulk. It’s such a good deal!
A: This wine is ridiculously cheap today.
B: Time to stock up! This price is crazy!
A: I just found my favorite cereal at half price.
B: Let’s grab a few more before the sale ends!
A: This place looks great! What’s good here?
B: Their pasta is amazing! You should try it.
A: I’ve never been here before. What do you recommend?
B: Our iced caramel latte is really popular!
A: I can’t decide… What’s the best thing on the menu?
B: Our signature burger is a customer favorite!
A: Hey, I’m visiting for the first time. What’s popular here?
B: You have to try the tacos!

similar: pay no attention to the guidelines

primary: scan and understand key points quickly
similar: skim and grasp main points quickly
I haven't seen you in ages.
I'm not sure what you mean.
What do you mean by that?
That's what we're going to do.
I can't do anything about it.
We were just talking about you.
To cut a long story short

examples: A: Who’s the funniest person in our group?
B: Oh, hands down, it’s Jake!
A: What’s the best show on Netflix right now?
B: Stranger Things, hands down.
A: Which coffee shop has the best lattes?
B: Blue Bottle, hands down!
A: Is she the best dancer in the class?
B: Hands down! No one even comes close.
A: Was the driving test hard?
B: Nah, it was a walk in the park!
A: Do you think you can finish the report by tonight?
B: Of course! It’s a piece of cake.
A: How was your first day at work?
B: Honestly, it was easy peasy. Nothing too difficult.
A: Was fixing the sink difficult?
B: Nope, no sweat at all!
A: Guess what? I just bumped into my high school teacher… in Paris!
B: What are the odds?! That’s crazy!
A: My new coworker is my childhood neighbor.
B: Seriously? What are the chances?
A: We got the same seat numbers on the plane.
B: No way! What are the odds of that happening?
A: I met someone at the party who has the exact same birthday as me.
B: Small world!
A: Did Mark show up to the meeting?
B: Nope. He didn’t even text.
A: What time did she turn up at the party?
B: Like 1 a.m. She was super late.
A: Are you gonna come through tonight?
B: You know it! Wouldn’t miss it for the world.
A: He didn’t show up again…
B: Ugh, third time this week.
A: What’s in that box?
B: Just some odds and ends I didn’t want to throw away.
A: Do you need help organizing your room?
B: Yeah, especially this drawer full of bits and pieces.
A: What are all these wires and screws for?
B: No idea. Just random junk I collected over time.
A: I’m donating stuff. Want any of these odds and ends?
B: Hmm, I’ll take a look. Never know what might be useful.
A: How’s studying for finals going?
B: Ugh, I’m losing it. I haven’t slept in two days.
A: You okay?
B: No! My computer crashed again. I’m seriously losing it.
A: Why are you laughing so hard?
B: That video was so stupid—I’m losing it.
A: Are you crying?
B: I’m just tired. I think I’m losing it a little…
A: I’ll take the chicken burrito with extra guac.
B: Same for me, please.
A: One caramel macchiato.
B: Make it two.
A: I’ll get the salmon bowl.
B: I’ll have what she’s having.
A: I’m ordering a vanilla latte.
B: Same here.

B: Same for me, please.

B: Make it two.

B: I’ll have what she’s having.

B: Same here.

B: Same for me, please.

B: Make it two.

B: I’ll have what she’s having.

B: Same here.

B: Same for me, please.

B: Make it two.

B: I’ll have what she’s having.

B: Same here.

B: Same for me, please.

B: Make it two.
